page.title: 18Gamekeeping In Dundrennan
page.content: The gamekeeper is a busy man. He works every month of the year.In February he catches up the hen pheasants to put in a pen to lay the eggs,which will be put into the big incubator. The eggs are usually in the incubator for a week and a half, then they are put into hatchers for the other half of the week. When the young are hatched they are put under an electric hen which is a heater that keeps them warm. At 9 weeks old they go to the woods to be reared. By then the gamekeeper should have fox snares and traps set for foxes, stoats, weasles, and mink. At three and a half months old they are released into the woods to be shot.By then the gamekeeper is sorting things out for the next year.
